intro: Markhamia tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly markhamia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
